wikipedia_page.main: Simeon Stuart (15 May 1864 – 25 November 1939) was a British film actor of the silent era.

response: The Vortex is a 1928 British drama film directed by Adrian Brunel and starring Ivor Novello, Willette Kershaw and Simeon Stuart.http://www.screenonline.org.uk/film/id/493433/index.html It was an adaptation of the Noël Coward play The Vortex and was made by Gainsborough Studios. The film's sets were designed by Clifford Pember.

link_mentions.page: The Face at the Window (1920 film)

response: The Shadow Between is a 1920 British silent crime film directed by George Dewhurst and starring Doris Lloyd, Lewis Dayton and Simeon Stuart.BFI.org It was adapted from the 1908 novel by Silas Hocking. The screenplay concerns a young Australian girl who travels to Britain after the death of her English father, who was a miner.

Rob Roy is a 1922 British silent historical film directed by W.P. Kellino and starring David Hawthorne, Gladys Jennings and Simeon Stuart. It depicts the life of the early 18th century outlaw Rob Roy MacGregor.
* Simeon Stuart as Duke of Montrose

Creation is a 1922 British silent drama film directed by Humberston Wright and starring Dorothy Fane, Frank Dane and Simeon Stuart. It is based on the novel The Man Who Dared by May Edginton.Goble p.143
Love's Influence is a 1922 British silent drama film directed by William S. Charlton and Edward Gordon and starring George K. Arthur, Flora le Breton and Simeon Stuart.Gifford p.175
* Simeon Stuart as Sir Miles Wellington
